programme.title: Gordon Ramsay’s Future Food Stars 1, ep. 6.
programme.desc: Gordon is celebrating the very best of British - exquisite produce and the pinnacle of fine dining. First, he invites his entrepreneurs to harvest oysters by hand on the glorious Essex coast. Using centuries-old techniques, they must collect as many restaurant-quality delicacies as they can. But it’s tough out on the mud flats, and the contenders battle their surroundings to maintain quality control, exposed to the elements.

programme.title: Catchpoint 4, ep. 3.
programme.desc: White battle it out against TV presenters Sam Nixon and Mark Rhodes, attempting to catch giant pink balls to win cash for charity.

programme.title: Joins BBC News, BBC One joins the BBC’s rolling news channel for a night of news.
BBC Wales Investigates, Families Fleeing War
programme.desc: Families ripped apart, and lives that will never be the same again. BBC Wales Investigates follows those families. A mother and her three children hide out amongst the ruins of Mariupol. Others describe the heartbreaking decisions they’ve been forced to make, to leave loved ones behind to fight - or just to survive.

programme.title: The Media Show, Reporting on the Abuse of Power
The Travel Show, Acropolis Now
programme.desc: Ade Adepitan is in Athens. He visits the Acropolis, Greece’s most popular tourist attraction, and experiences the new accessibility improvements made at the site.

programme.title: HARDtalk, Jim Green, Former Chief Scientist at Nasa
World Business Report
programme.desc: The latest news from the business world with analysis and speculation, straight from the world’s leading financial centres.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The BBC’s Breakfast programme features the latest news, sport, business, weather and other items on a daily basis.

programme.title: Rip-Off Britain 14, ep. 7.
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Julia Somerville and Gloria Hunniford share the latest consumer advice.

programme.title: Dom Delivers, Reversion: Takeaways
programme.desc: Dom Littlewood finds out just how much work goes into takeaway deliveries as he follows the journey of the nation’s favourite Indian dish, a chicken tikka masala. Joining the staff at the award-winning Lime Pickle takeaway in Birmingham, he turns his hand to making naan breads for a care home and gets on his bike to deliver takeaways within the restaurant’s 45-minute guarantee.

programme.title: The State Opening of Parliament, 2022
programme.desc: Live coverage of the Queen’s Speech from Westminster. A unique combination of pageantry and politics opens the second session of the new Parliament, as HM the Queen outlines the government’s plans for the coming year.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Brighton Racecourse plays host to today’s programme. Presenter Christina Trevanion leads the proceedings, while experts Catherine Southon and Mark Stacey help the teams track down bargains that could make them a profit at the auction. Christina also learns from a gramophone guru how to spot the difference between an authentic gramophone and a replica.

programme.title: Doctors 23, ep. 40.
programme.desc: Princess continues to cause trouble between Sid and Bear while Emma is on a mission to help Maeve. Daniel plays matchmaker when two music lovers cross paths at the Campus Surgery.

programme.title: Five Bedrooms 2, ep. 7.
programme.desc: Flailing in his open relationship, Harry leaves a string of deeply regrettable voicemails on Xavier’s phone. Meanwhile, Heather discovers a potential career opportunity. S2 Ep7

programme.title: Bijeg na selo 22, ep. 46.
programme.desc: A couple are leaving Spain for good and want to settle in the countryside of either Shropshire or Herefordshire. Steve Brown accepts the challenge to find them their new home.

programme.title: Spašavanje vrta 7, ep. 2.
programme.desc: Sid and Dan would like their dual heritage reflected in their first garden together; Dan is of Polish and German heritage whilst Sid would love the designers to reflect his Indian heritage in the design.

programme.title: The Bidding Room 3, ep. 25.
programme.desc: First through the doors is Vivian, with a unique miniature gardening kit. It fascinates Nigel and Simon, but will our dealers love it enough to reach the price tag that Vivian has in mind?

programme.title: Pointless 26, ep. 4.
programme.desc: A twist on the classic quiz show formula, contestants search through the depths of their knowledge in an attempt to score as few points as possible.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne and Jermaine Jenas present stories that matter from across the country.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat is riled by Phil and Sam, Zack is put in an awkward position by Martin, and Ben’s anger holds no bounds.

programme.title: DIY SOS 32, ep. 1.
programme.desc: Midwife Lindsey married ex-Royal Engineer Shaun in 2019. Lindsey had two children from a previous marriage and then had two boys with Shaun.

programme.title: Freeze the Fear with Wim Hof 1, ep. 5.
programme.desc: The celebrities must hold their nerve as they attempt to complete yoga stances on a tiny beam, which is suspended hundreds of feet above a frozen waterfall. They then attempt their scariest challenge so far - swimming underneath a frozen lake.

programme.title: Križić-kružić 2, ep. 3.
programme.desc: Following two young people, Sephy and Callum, who live in a dystopian contemporary state divided by colour. Sephy is a member of the black ruling class, whereas Callum is part of the white underclass, and they must fight to be together.

programme.title: Love in the Flesh 1, ep. 7.
programme.desc: It is the penultimate day in the beach house and the last chance for the five remaining couples to cement their bonds. Three of the couples had already built connections online; the other two met here in the beach house just four days ago. To find out which of the couples are truly on the same page, Zara organises a challenge on the beach and asks the couples for total honesty when answering her questions.

programme.title: Love in the Flesh 1, ep. 8.
programme.desc: In the series finale, the three remaining couples each go on a date to consider their relationships beyond the beach house. Only the strongest can walk away with the biggest prize.

programme.title: Joins BBC News, BBC One joins the BBC’s rolling news channel for a night of news.
Click
programme.desc: Travelling to Washington to look at the latest tech being used to take down drones, and to Shetland to see how 5G is being used to make things safer on a construction site.

programme.title: The Travel Show, Acropolis Now
programme.desc: Ade Adepitan is in Athens. He visits the Acropolis, Greece’s most popular tourist attraction, and experiences the new accessibility improvements made at the site.

programme.title: Panorama, Fixing Unfair Britain: Can Levelling Up Deliver?
programme.desc: Levelling up is one of Boris Johnson’s flagship policies. It’s intended to improve the quality of life for millions of people who live outside London and the south east by investing in local communities and infrastructure. Billions of pounds have been allocated for high streets, transport links and skills. The BBC’s new political editor Chris Mason returns to his home county of Yorkshire to find out what the residents of Barnsley think of the policy.

programme.title: World Business Report
programme.desc: The latest news from the business world with analysis and speculation, straight from the world’s leading financial centres.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The BBC’s Breakfast programme features the latest news, sport, business, weather and other items on a daily basis.

programme.title: Rip-Off Britain 14, ep. 8.
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Julia Somerville and Gloria Hunniford share the latest consumer advice.

programme.title: For Love or Money 2, ep. 2.
programme.desc: When Paul met a new partner on a dating site, he thought he’d met the woman of his dreams. But when she started asking for large sums of his money to help unlock a treasure trove she had inherited, their relationship took an expensively dark turn.

programme.title: Dom Delivers, Reversion: Supermarkets
programme.desc: Dom Littlewood investigates the supply chain of major supermarket, following a box of frozen pasties from the pie factory to a customer who has ordered them for her tea. Along the way, he has to get to grips with groceries, finding that there’s no substitute for good timing as he races against the clock to pick and deliver the shopping.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer 25, ep. 15.
programme.desc: Martel is in Dalry, Ayrshire to see a ground floor, one bedroom flat with two front doors. Tommy is in Norwich visiting a former office which comes with plans to turn it into flats.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The reds and blues are bargain hunting in Lincolnshire with the help of experts Nick Hall and Gary Pe. Presenter Charlie Ross learns about what people can do if they find treasure at the bottom of their garden.

programme.title: Doctors 23, ep. 41.
programme.desc: Daniel and Valerie’s secret project is finally revealed, and has Princess met her match in Emma? When a teenage girl goes missing, it’s a difficult time for her mother but also for the mother of a girl who vanished two years before.

programme.title: Five Bedrooms 2, ep. 8.
programme.desc: The household dynamic is under threat when an unexpected decision is announced and the timing couldn’t be worse for the roommates.

programme.title: Bijeg na selo 22, ep. 11.
programme.desc: There are two counties for the price of one today as Nicki Chapman visits Somerset and Dorset with a buyer from London who is in search of a new life and a new home in the countryside for her £800k budget. Whilst in the area, Nicki also visits the town of Frome to learn how a fridge is helping to bring the local community together.

programme.title: Spašavanje vrta 7, ep. 3.
programme.desc: After many years in the armed forces, this is Chris and Karina’s first forever home. Chris hates the garage, and Karina hates the path. They both want Charlie and Lee to help them reimagine their garden with £3,000.

programme.title: The Bidding Room 2, ep. 1.
programme.desc: Deep in the Yorkshire countryside, Nigel Havers welcomes five people with intriguing pieces they would like to sell. To help them before they face the dealers, Nigel introduces them to resident valuation expert Simon, who has been an auctioneer for nearly 30 years. Simon provides the sellers with specialist information about the items’ history and an educated valuation.

programme.title: Pointless 26, ep. 5.
programme.desc: A twist on the classic quiz show formula, contestants search through the depths of their knowledge in an attempt to score as few points as possible.

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Lauren Laverne and Jermaine Jenas present stories that matter from across the country.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Howie is finding it hard to tell Kim how he feels, Callum and Ben are about to start a new chapter in their life when reality hits, and Denise is under serious pressure when the salon is targeted.

programme.title: The Repair Shop 10, ep. 1.
programme.desc: First into the barn is Sandie Ennis, with a handbag that belonged to her late mother, the perfect project for leather expert Suzie Fletcher. Gordon Barnes has come to the workshop with a custom-made wooden windmill in the shape of Noah’s Ark.

programme.title: Dobar, bolji, najbolji... kroz ušicu igle 8, ep. 3.
programme.desc: The ten remaining home sewers create light and airy outfits for summer week. Patrick and Esme kick off with a pattern for a high fashion shirred midi dress with puff sleeves.

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights from three midweek Premier League fixtures, which include Leeds United v Chelsea and Watford v Everton.
